{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amniotic fluid is the fluid that surrounds and protects the baby during pregnancy. It is contained in the amniotic sac. The color of normal amniotic fluid is typically clear with a slight yellow tinge. It should not be green, as this could indicate that the baby has passed meconium (stool) in the womb, which can be a sign of distress. It also should not be milky, amber, or golden, as these could indicate infection or other complications.", "answer_choice": "C. Clear colorless to Pale Yellow"}
